question_stem.en:
Blood pressure measurements are obtained from a sample of individuals with no known medical conditions. For systolic blood pressure (SBP), the mean measurements and associated standard deviations (SDs) are shown by age group for men and women: {{exhibit_1}}

If hypertension is defined as SBP >140 mm Hg, approximately what percentage of men age 35-44 in this sample will be classified as having hypertension, assuming a normal (Gaussian) distribution?
question_stem.zh:
从一组无已知疾病的个体中获得血压测量值。对于收缩压 (SBP)，按年龄组显示男性和女性的平均测量值和相关标准差 (SD)：{{exhibit_1}}

如果高血压定义为 SBP >140 mm Hg，假设呈正态（高斯）分布，该样本中 35-44 岁男性的大约百分之多少将被归类为患有高血压？

question.en: If hypertension is defined as SBP >140 mm Hg, approximately what percentage of men age 35-44 in this sample will be classified as having hypertension, assuming a normal (Gaussian) distribution?
question.zh: 如果高血压定义为 SBP >140 mm Hg，假设呈正态（高斯）分布，该样本中 35-44 岁男性的大约百分之多少将被归类为患有高血压？

explanation.en:
A normal (Gaussian) distribution refers to a symmetrical, bell-shaped distribution with a fixed proportion of observations lying within a certain distance of the mean. This distance is called the STANDARD DEVIATION (SD) and reflects the degree of dispersion from the mean. According to the properties of this distribution, 68% of observations lie within 1 SD on either side of the mean, with half (ie, 68/2 = 34%) above and half (34%) below the mean. The remaining 32% (= 100% – 68%) lie outside 1 SD from the mean, with half (ie, 32/2 = 16%) above and the other half (16%) below 1 SD from the mean. In addition, 95% of all observations lie within 2 SDs of the mean, and 99.7% of all observations lie within 3 SDs of the mean. This is the 68-95-99.7 rule. {{exhibit_2}}

For men age 35-44 in this sample, the mean systolic blood pressure (SBP) is 120 mm Hg with an SD of 20 mm Hg. Therefore, subjects with SBP >140 mm Hg (to fit the proposed definition of hypertension) represent observations >1 SD above the mean. Based on the 68-95-99.7 rule, 32% of observations (= 100% – 68%) lie outside 1 SD from the mean, with half (16%) above and half (16%) below 1 SD from the mean. Therefore, 16% of men age 35-44 have SBP >140 mm Hg.

(Choices B, C, D, and E) Based on the 68-95-99.7 rule, 34% of subjects lie either 1 SD above the mean or 1 SD below the mean. In men age 35-44:

34% have SBP 100-120 mm Hg, 34% have SBP 120-140 mm Hg, and, 68% have SBP 100-140 mm Hg.
Half (50%) have SBP above the mean (ie, >120 mm Hg) and half have SBP below the mean (<120 mm Hg).
Given that 84% = 50% + 34%, this could represent the sum of those with SBP 100-120 mm Hg (34%) and those with SBP >120 mm Hg (50%); in other words, those with SBP >100 mm Hg.
(Choice F) Based on the 68-95-99.7 rule, 95% of observations lie within 2 SDs (eg, 2 × 20 = 40 mm Hg) of the mean (eg, 120 mm Hg) (ie, SBP between 80 mm Hg [= 120 – 40] and 160 mm Hg [= 120 + 40]).
explanation.zh:
正态（高斯）分布是指一种对称的钟形分布，其固定比例的观测值位于均值的某个特定距离内。该距离称为标准差 (SD)，反映了与均值的离散程度。根据该分布的性质，68% 的观测值位于均值两侧的 1 个 SD 范围内，其中一半（即 68/2 = 34%）高于均值，一半 (34%) 低于均值。剩余的 32% (= 100% – 68%) 位于均值之外的 1 个 SD 范围之外，其中一半（即 32/2 = 16%）高于均值，另一半 (16%) 低于均值之外的 1 个 SD 范围。此外，95% 的所有观测值位于均值的 2 个 SD 范围内，99.7% 的所有观测值位于均值的 3 个 SD 范围内。这就是 68-95-99.7 规则。{{exhibit_2}}

对于该样本中 35-44 岁的男性，平均收缩压 (SBP) 为 120 mm Hg，SD 为 20 mm Hg。因此，SBP >140 mm Hg（以符合拟议的高血压定义）的受试者代表高于均值的 >1 个 SD 的观测值。根据 68-95-99.7 规则，32% 的观测值 (= 100% – 68%) 位于均值之外的 1 个 SD 范围之外，其中一半 (16%) 高于均值，一半 (16%) 低于均值之外的 1 个 SD 范围。因此，16% 的 35-44 岁男性 SBP >140 mm Hg。

（选项 B、C、D 和 E）根据 68-95-99.7 规则，34% 的受试者位于均值上方或下方 1 个 SD 的位置。在 35-44 岁的男性中：

34% 的 SBP 为 100-120 mm Hg，34% 的 SBP 为 120-140 mm Hg，68% 的 SBP 为 100-140 mm Hg。
一半 (50%) 的 SBP 高于均值（即，>120 mm Hg），一半的 SBP 低于均值 (<120 mm Hg)。
鉴于 84% = 50% + 34%，这可能代表 SBP 为 100-120 mm Hg (34%) 和 SBP >120 mm Hg (50%) 的总和；换句话说，SBP >100 mm Hg 的人。
（选项 F）根据 68-95-99.7 规则，95% 的观测值位于均值的 2 个 SD 范围内（例如，2 × 20 = 40 mm Hg）（例如，120 mm Hg）（即，SBP 在 80 mm Hg [= 120 – 40] 和 160 mm Hg [= 120 + 40] 之间）。

summary.en:
This question tests the understanding of normal distribution and standard deviation in the context of blood pressure measurements. It requires applying the 68-95-99.7 rule to estimate the percentage of individuals exceeding a certain blood pressure threshold.

The key to solving this question is to recognize that the problem involves a normal distribution and to use the 68-95-99.7 rule to determine the percentage of values above a certain threshold. Calculate how many standard deviations away from the mean the threshold is, and then apply the rule.
summary.zh:
本题考察对血压测量背景下正态分布和标准差的理解。它要求应用 68-95-99.7 规则来估计超过某个血压阈值的个体的百分比。

解决这个问题的关键在于认识到这个问题涉及正态分布，并使用 68-95-99.7 规则来确定高于某个阈值的值的百分比。计算阈值与均值相差多少个标准差，然后应用该规则。
